io.jecklgamis.util

Interface Try<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the result

    public interface Try<T>
    An abstraction of a result that could possibly fail because of an exception. Use @see TryFactory.attempt() to create a Try.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Try<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> p)
      Returns this Success if the predicate is satisfied.
      <U> Try<U> flatMap(TryFunction<? super T,Try<U>> fn)
      Applies the given function to the result if this is a Success.
      default <U> void forEach(TryFunction<T,U> fn)
      Applies the the given method (side-effect) on the result if this is a Success.
      T get()
      Returns the resulting value of the given expression if this is a Success, otherwise throws a RuntimeException wrapping the original exception if this is a Failure.
      T getOrElse(Supplier<T> fn)
      Applies the given function if this is a Failure otherwise return this Success.
      T getOrElse(T value)
      Returns the given value if this is a Failure otherwise return this Success.
      boolean isFailure()
      Returns true if this is Failure, false if this is a Success.
      boolean isSuccess()
      Returns true if this is Success, false if this is a Failure.
      <U> Try<U> map(TryFunction<? super T,U> fn)
      Applies the given function to the result wrapped in a Try if this is a Success, otherwise return this Failure.
      Try<T> orElse(Supplier<Try<T>> fn)
      Returns this if it is a Success, otherwise apply the given function.
      default void orElseThrow(Throwable t)
      Throws the given Throwable if this is a Failure.
      Try<T> recover(TryFunction<? super Throwable,T> fn)
      Applies this function if this is a Failure, otherwise return this Failure
      Try<T> recoverWith(TryFunction<? super Throwable,Try<T>> fn)
      Applies this function if this is a Failure, otherwise return this Failure
      Optional<T> toOptional()
      Converts this to a non-empty Optional if this is Success, otherwise return Optional.empty

    • Method Detail

      • get

        T get()
        Returns the resulting value of the given expression if this is a Success, otherwise throws a RuntimeException wrapping the original exception if this is a Failure.
        Returns:
        the value or exception being thrown

      • isSuccess

        boolean isSuccess()
        Returns true if this is Success, false if this is a Failure.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • isFailure

        boolean isFailure()
        Returns true if this is Failure, false if this is a Success.
        Returns:
        true or otherwise

      • map

        <U> Try<U> map(TryFunction<? super T,U> fn)
        Applies the given function to the result wrapped in a Try if this is a Success, otherwise return this Failure.
        Type Parameters:
        U - mapped return value type
        Parameters:
        fn - mapping function
        Returns:
        mapped value

      • flatMap

        <U> Try<U> flatMap(TryFunction<? super T,Try<U>> fn)
        Applies the given function to the result if this is a Success. If that function fails a Failure is returned. If this is a Failure, the Failure is simply returned.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the return type of the resulting Try
        Parameters:
        fn - the function to apply
        Returns:
        Try

      • filter

        Try<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> p)
        Returns this Success if the predicate is satisfied. Else return this Failure.
        Parameters:
        p - predicate
        Returns:
        a Try

      • forEach

        default <U> void forEach(TryFunction<T,U> fn)
        Applies the the given method (side-effect) on the result if this is a Success. Otherwise, do nothing.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the return type of the applied function
        Parameters:
        fn - the function to apply

      • getOrElse

        T getOrElse(Supplier<T> fn)
        Applies the given function if this is a Failure otherwise return this Success.
        Parameters:
        fn - the function to apply
        Returns:
        function application result or result of Success

      • getOrElse

        T getOrElse(T value)
        Returns the given value if this is a Failure otherwise return this Success.
        Parameters:
        value - the value
        Returns:
        value or the result of this Success

      • orElse

        Try<T> orElse(Supplier<Try<T>> fn)
        Returns this if it is a Success, otherwise apply the given function. If an exception occurs when applying the function, a Failure is returned with the thrown exception
        Parameters:
        fn - the function to apply
        Returns:
        Try

      • orElseThrow

        default void orElseThrow(Throwable t)
                  throws Throwable
        Throws the given Throwable if this is a Failure.
        Parameters:
        t - the Throwable
        Throws:
        Throwable - the Throwable

      • toOptional

        Optional<T> toOptional()
        Converts this to a non-empty Optional if this is Success, otherwise return Optional.empty
        Returns:
        the Optional

      • recover

        Try<T> recover(TryFunction<? super Throwable,T> fn)
        Applies this function if this is a Failure, otherwise return this Failure
        Parameters:
        fn - the function that recovers from the throwable
        Returns:
        the Try
